intro: Uragoga riedeliana, commonly known as the Riedel's uragoga, is a rare flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments, such as the understory of rainforests. Its flowers are usually pink or purple and bloom during the wet season. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
